metadata.dc:author: Llarena Ibarguren, R
Blasco de Villalonga, M
Pertusa Peña, C
Vesga Molina, F
metadata.dc:description: The florid post-TUR syndrome observed in one of our patients prompted us to conduct a prospective study on 100 males undergoing TUR to determine the natremia levels that could herald the presentation of this syndrome. Several parameters were evaluated, including pre- and post-operative serum sodium levels, total volume of irrigant used, and the weight of the resected prostate. Although the natremia levels dropped significantly in 4 patients, only the patient who had motivated this study developed symptoms and evidently no conclusions can be drawn on the basis of a single observation.
metadata.dc:title: Predice la hiponatremia el síndrome post-RTU?
[Does hyponatremia predict post-transurethral resection of the prostate syndrome?].
